head.p: From: wolfesphoenix@gmail.com To: john.smith@t-online.de Re: Unusual School Project

p.s: iI am really sorry for answering so late, iI had to learn for an exam and didn't have the time to answer.
In you last e-mail you told me, that you are working on a presentation about unusual school projects world wide.
Are you finished with it, or do you still need my help?
I will help you anyway.
I found a really interesting article about a chess project in Germany.
Since the article is written in English I will summarize it for you.
The newspaper article, written by Joachim Göries, published in the TAZ on the 30.06.2020, deals with a chess project in Bremen.
The TAZ is a newspaper in Germany.
The Thesisthesis of the article is that chess has a positive Influenceinfluence on the concentration and on the practical and logical ways of thinking.
It should also improve the communication between class members.
Last year, almost 1.226 pupils, out of 56 classes, took part in this school project.
This year the Numbernumber of pupils which take part in the project doubled.
All those pupils got chess lessons, one per week.
The teachers, which took part in the project, took part in a survey.
In this survey, 72% said that their classes were happy about the chess lessons and and that they took them full of joy.
23% of the teachers said that many of the pupils, who took part in the project last year, stated playing chess in their freetime.
37% of the teachers were sure, that playing chess will improve the concentration from the pupils, and the communication between the class members.
Almost eveyoneeveryone of the surveyed teachers said that their expactationsexpectations got fullfilled.
Isn't that crazy?
At the Theodore-Mommsen school in Bad Oldesloe pubilspupils from the 8th and 9th Gradegrade had to choose their compulsory subject.
18 boys and nine girls chose chess as their compulsory subject.
Günther Klemm the teacher of the subject said that his students learn, how to deal with losing, how to deal with consequences and how they keep in rules.
This are just a couple of positive things they learn.
Some of the benefits are that winning hasn't to do anything with body strenghtstrength, someone who is weak can win against someone who is strong.
They learn how to deal with competing against weaker and stronger players.
It's also independent how old you are, Klemm's lesson is filled with pubilspupils different ages.
Another example is a primary school in Hamburg named Genslerstraße.
They have Chesschess as a compulsory subject in all four school years.
They have one lesson per week.
Gabriela Rieckow, leader of chess lessons, said that it is really significant that their students are improving in Mathmath.
Their students gain much from their chess lessons.
For example they said that playing chess has positivpositive effects on concentration, communication between older and younger people, social behavior and also on general education.
She also mentioned that the boys take part in tournaments more often than the girls, even though they play the same.
Gabriela Rieckow thinks, itsit's because they like to challenge each other in order to compare themselves to each other.
The only negative thing about the whole project they mentioned is, that good players tend to get bored and bad players are tend to looselose interest in chess.
In order to teach the student effectively you have to show them interest in chess and love to play.
They have to enjoy it.
As a summary you can say that the result of this unusual project is very positivpositive.
The students gained many positive characteristics.
As mentioned earlier.
at the end of the project they made a large tournament on the townhallplacetown hall place in Bremen.
1000 girls and boys took part and showed what they learned.
I think playing chess is really fun, I played it too with my brother, because he was in a Chess group.
Did you or do you play chess?
At my primary school, we also had chess groups.
I think it's a great opportunity for schools.
What do you think Alex?
Do you need more help with a project?
Just call me.
